parameters: "Firewall detected!" + NewLine() + "SSH: 22 - Closed" + NewLine() + "FTP: 21 - Closed" + NewLine() + "HTTP: 80 - Closed"
"<duoi> how do i stop getting my puter infected with adware when downloading porn" + NewLine()
"<duoi> but how will i find out about lonely singles in my local area" + NewLine()
"<hdqn> look into every window in the neighbourhood, if they're IRCing that's your best best" + NewLine()
"<hdqn> the shorter the handle, the longer the candle, if y'know what I mean" + NewLine()
"<froggey> which is another dependency, and another place for people to fuck up and send me bug reports" + NewLine()
"<aejsmith> they're all terrible, so just avoid that problem by not having anyone use your software" + NewLine()
"<froggey> I'm trying! I'm building the weirdest and most useless possible software and yet people still want to use it" + NewLine()
"<froggey> I don't understand it at all" + NewLine()

objects.name: NewObject3
objects.string:
Thank you for playing the concept of my game, which was developed specifically for the GameOFF 2021 gamejam.
This is my first developed game, so I don't really pretend to win prizes, and I made this game in 2 days.
Thanks again!

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The name of the timer to repeat
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerName

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerLength

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
propertyDescriptors.name: Limit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Ahnaf30e
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Adds expressions to get the current FPS and a behavior to display the current FPS easily.

The FPS, Frames Per Second, describes how many times in the last second your game got updated. An update consists in running all the behaviors, objects, and events sheet code, before rendering the new game state into the game window. The higher the FPS, the more it manages to update in a second, influencing how fluid and performant your game looks.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FPS
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds expressions and a behavior to get and display the game FPS.

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count.
eventsFunctions.name: FPS

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count, with more control over rounding.
eventsFunctions.name: PreciseFPS

parameters.longDescription: This tells how many numbers after the period should be shown.
parameters.name: accuracy

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Makes a text object display the current FPS.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FPSDisplayer

propertyDescriptors.label: The prefix before the FPS count
propertyDescriptors.name: prefix
